s at about 1K/s on MacOSX.


Gordon Mohr wrote:
>  
>
> anas elghafari wrot=
e:
> >
> >
> > Hi there,
> >
> > I am running Heritrix on a Mac, I run an e=
xperiment to see how much CPU
> > does Heritrix take (using MacOS Activity =
Monitor). While launching
> > Heritrix's WUI and setting up a job, the CPU =
usage is about 4%. Strting
> > a crawl job with several seeds quickly raise=
s CPU usage to about 99%.
> > However, pausing the crawl job does NOT reduc=
e the CPU usage. Even more
> > surprisingly, terminating a crawl job does n=
ot reduce the CPU usg. Only
> > when Heritrix WUI is shut down does the CPU=
 usage return to it was
> > before the crawl job was started.
> >
> > Is th=
is a known issue? Am I doing something wrong?
>
> This is not a known issue=
, on MacOS or elsewhere.
>
> What JVM version and Heritrix version?
>
> Usi=
ng 'jstack' against the Java process a few times in succession may
> give a=
 hint as to what Java thread(s) are still busy during a period
> (such as a=
fter job termination) when there should be little to no
> activity.
>
> I'm=
 not sure if the threads of a MacOS JVM are individually viewable in
> the =
Activity Monitor (for example with the 'All Processeses,
> Hierarchically' =
view), but if so, it may be possible to correlate the
> Activity Monitor PI=
D with one of the thread IDs in the jstack dump, and
> thus be certain whic=
h thread(s) are busy.
>
> - Gordon @ IA
>
>
